title: Google Pixel 4 And Pixel 4XL Launched: Here's Everything You Need To Know
text:
Google Pixel 4 And Pixel 4XL Launched: Here's Everything You Need To Know

Google Pixel 4 And Pixel 4XL Launched: Here's Everything You Need To Know

Google has finally gone ahead and revealed the much-awaited (and much leaked) Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL. The Google flagships run on the (somewhat) latest and greatest hardware with a revamped camera setup to take superior photos.

Here's everything you need to know about the Pixel 4 and the Pixel 4XL.

Google

Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL Display

Google's Pixel 4 gets a 5.7-inch full-HD+ OLED display with a resolution of 1080 x 2160 pixels, whereas the Pixel 4XL gets a larger 6.3-inch QHD+ OLED panel with a resolution of 1440 x 3040 pixels. These get a 90hz high-refresh-rate which Google calls 'Smooth Display'-- similar to the one seen on the OnePlus 7T and OnePlus 7T Pro.

Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL Camera

We already knew for a fact that Google's Pixel 4 and the Pixel 4XL are getting a dual-camera setup after Google teased it to the world a few months back. We now know for a fact that the camera setup gets a 12-megapixel primary shooter and a 16-megapixel telephoto shooter.

This comes along with some major software improvements like Live HDR+, better white balance with AI, and improved Nightsight to generate better imagery.

Don't Miss 535 SHARES

Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL Hardware

Under the hood, Google's hardware choice might disappoint many. For starters, it is using the dated Snapdragon 855 octa-core processor. While it is no slouch when it comes to performance, they could have picked the slightly faster and newer Snapdragon 855+ which is an overclocked version of Snapdragon 855.

This comes paired with 6GB of RAM. You also get 64GB and 128GB storage variants.

For battery, the Pixel 4 gets a disappointing 2800 mAh battery, whereas the Pixel 4XL gets a decent 3700mAh battery.

Google

Google Motion Gestures & Face Unlock

Before the launch, Google also teased the Motion gestures on the Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL, and now they're finally here. To the uninitiated, The top section of the Pixel 4's include a Face unlock IR camera, a standard front-facing camera, An ambiernt light/ proximity sensor, a Soli Radar chip, a Face Unlock Dot Projector, another Face Unlock IR camera and a Face unlock Flood Illuminator. Moreover, Google has also stated that all the face data will be stored securely in the Titan M chip on the Pixel 4.

Google

Google Pixel 4 and Pixel 4XL Pricing and availability

Google Pixel 4 is priced at $799 for the 64GB variant and $899 for the 128GB variant. Google Pixel 4XL, on the other hand, is priced at $899 for the 64GB variant and $999 for the 128GB variant. The device is already available for pre-orders in the US and will hit the shelves in the US on October 22nd. Sadly, as per Google, the device will not be launched in India.
